summary: This document consists of Bureau of Prisons count sheets, inmate rosters, and official count slips from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 8, 2019. The records show inmate counts by housing unit and include a specific entry for an inmate in the hospital with the assignment code 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG', indicating a suicide watch or unassigned status. The documents appear to be routine prison administrative records from the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: Daily inmate counts at MCC New York
events.description: Routine inmate counts were conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, with specific counts recorded for various housing units (B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, Z-B). One inmate was listed in the hospital with the assignment 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: These are Bureau of Prisons administrative records dated August 8, 2019, from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
One inmate was recorded in the hospital with the assignment code 'SUICIDE OR UNASSG', which typically indicates suicide watch or unassigned status.
The documents show routine inmate counts by housing unit with a total inmate population of approximately 763-761 individuals.
The records include multiple count verification forms and inmate rosters from the same date.
These appear to be standard prison administrative documents from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the time of his death.
